1.name: A Streetcar Named Desire
1.description: Disturbed Blanche DuBois moves in with her sister in New Orleans and is tormented by her brutish brother-in-law while her reality crumbles around her.

2.name: The Thing from Another World
2.description: Scientists and American Air Force officials fend off a bloodthirsty alien organism while at a remote arctic outpost.

3.name: The Day the Earth Stood Still
3.description: An alien lands and tells the people of Earth that they must live peacefully or be destroyed as a danger to other planets.

4.name: Alice in Wonderland
4.description: Alice stumbles into the world of Wonderland. Will she get home? Not if the Queen of Hearts has her way.

5.name: The African Queen
5.description: In WWI Africa, a gin-swilling riverboat captain is persuaded by a strait-laced missionary to use his boat to attack an enemy warship.

6.name: Strangers on a Train
6.description: A psychopath forces a tennis star to comply with his theory that two strangers can get away with murder.

7.name: Ace in the Hole
7.description: A frustrated former big-city journalist now stuck working for an Albuquerque newspaper exploits a story about a man trapped in a cave to rekindle his career, but the situation quickly escalates into an out-of-control circus.

8.name: Strictly Dishonorable
8.description: An Italian opera singer ( Eliot Pinza) has a marriage of convenience with an innocent fan ( Janet Leigh) from Mississippi

9.name: Westward the Women
9.description: A trail guide escorts a group of women from Chicago to California to marry men that have recently began settling there.

10.name: A Place in the Sun
10.description: A poor boy gets a job working for his rich uncle and ends up falling in love with two women.

11.name: Grounds for Marriage
11.description: Opera singer Ina Massine tries to win back former husband Dr. Lincoln I. Bartlett.

12.name: An American in Paris
12.description: Three friends struggle to find work in Paris. Things become more complicated when two of them fall in love with the same woman.

13.name: Quo Vadis
13.description: Fierce Roman commander Marcus Vinicius becomes infatuated with beautiful Christian hostage Lygia and begins questioning the tyrannical leadership of the despot Emperor Nero.

14.name: David and Bathsheba
14.description: After King David sees the beautiful Bathsheba bathing from the palace roof, he enters into an adulterous affair which has tragic consequences for his family and Israel.

15.name: Scrooge
15.description: Old bitter miser Ebenezer Scrooge (Alastair Sim) is given a chance for redemption when he is haunted by three ghosts on Christmas Eve.

16.name: The Son of Dr. Jekyll
16.description: Edward Jekyll, ignorant of how his father had brought forth death and destruction with his experiments, is pursuing a chemist career despite the fact that he has been discharged from school...                See full summary »

17.name: When Worlds Collide
17.description: As a new star and planet hurtle toward a doomed Earth, a small group of survivalists frantically work to complete the rocket which will take them to their new home.

18.name: Atoll K
18.description: Stan inherits a yacht and a South Pacific island. Ollie and Stan sail there with 2 other men. They shipwreck on a new atoll and settle there. An ex-fiancee joins them. They declare an independent nation and problems arise.

19.name: Happy Go Lovely
19.description: B.G. Bruno, a rich bachelor, the head of a successful greeting-card company in Scotland, is essentially a kind man but respectable to the point of stodginess and extreme stuffiness. An ...                See full summary »

20.name: The Secret of Convict Lake
20.description: In 1871 a convict escapes, with other prisoners, to kill the man that framed him, but has second thoughts after meeting the man's beautiful future wife.

21.name: The Tragedy of Othello: The Moor of Venice
21.description: The Moorish General Othello is manipulated into thinking that his new wife Desdemona has been carrying on an affair with his Lieutenant Michael Cassio when in reality, it is all part of the scheme of a bitter Ensign named Iago.

22.name: Royal Wedding
22.description: A brother and sister dance act encounter challenges and romance when booked in London during the Royal Wedding.

23.name: His Kind of Woman
23.description: A deported gangster's plan to re-enter the USA involves skulduggery at a Mexican resort, and gambler Dan Milner is caught in the middle.

24.name: The Man in the White Suit
24.description: An altruistic chemist invents a fabric which resists wear and stain as a boon to humanity, but big business and labor realize it must be suppressed for economic reasons.

25.name: On Dangerous Ground
25.description: Rough city cop Jim Wilson is disciplined by his captain and is sent upstate, to a snowy mountain town, to help the local sheriff solve a murder case.

26.name: Show Boat
26.description: The daughter of a riverboat captain falls in love with a charming gambler, but their fairytale romance is threatened when his luck turns sour.

27.name: No Highway
27.description: An aeronautical engineer predicts that a new model of plane will fail catastrophically and in a novel manner after a specific number flying hours.

28.name: Captain Horatio Hornblower R.N.
28.description: During the Napoleonic wars, a British Navy Captain has adventures in Central American waters.

29.name: People Will Talk
29.description: Dr. Noah Praetorius falls in love with Debra, a student who finds out that she is pregnant by her old boyfriend.

30.name: M
30.description: In this Americanization of the 1931 German thriller, both the police and the criminal underworld stalk a mysterious killer who preys on small children.

31.name: Across the Wide Missouri
31.description: Trapper Flint Mitchell and other mountain men from the Rendezvous join forces to enter virgin trapping territory but must contend with a resentful Blackfoot chief.

32.name: Journal d'un curé de campagne
32.description: A young priest taking over the parish at Ambricourt tries to fulfill his duties even as he fights a mysterious stomach ailment.

33.name: On Moonlight Bay
33.description: During World War I, a teenage girl begins a romance with a college student, but his unconventional attitudes cause friction with her father.

34.name: The Lavender Hill Mob
34.description: A meek bank clerk who oversees the shipment of bullion joins with an eccentric neighbor to steal gold bars and smuggle them out of the country as miniature Eiffel Towers.

35.name: Vengeance Valley
35.description: The sons of a Colorado cattle baron, one biological and the other adopted, resent one another and fight for control of their father's cattle empire.

36.name: Jim Thorpe -- All-American
36.description: The triumph and tragedy of Native American Jim Thorpe, who, after winning both the pentathlon and decathlon in the same Olympics, is stripped of his medals on a technicality.

37.name: The Enforcer
37.description: A crusading district attorney finally gets a chance to prosecute the organizer and boss of Murder Inc.

38.name: Early Summer
38.description: A family chooses a match for their daughter Noriko, but she, surprisingly, has her own plans.

39.name: The Red Badge of Courage
39.description: Truncated adaptation of Stephen Crane's novel about a Civil War Union soldier who stuggles to find the courage to fight in the heat of battle.

40.name: The Mob
40.description: Johnny Damico botches a murder case and is suspended from the force. In reality, he is put undercover to identify the mysterious boss of the NY waterfront who has murdered everyone in his way. Will Johnny be next in line?

41.name: Rawhide
41.description: A stagecoach stop employee and a stranded woman traveller find themselves at the mercy of four desperate outlaws intent on robbing the next day's gold shipment.

42.name: The River
42.description: Three adolescent girls growing up in Bengal, India, learn their lessons in life after falling for an older American soldier.

43.name: The Desert Fox: The Story of Rommel
43.description: The story of the final years of the respected World War II German general, Erwin Rommel.

44.name: Miracolo a Milano
44.description: An open hearted and unrelentingly energetic orphan struggles to make the best out of his life on the streets of Milan.

45.name: Pandora and the Flying Dutchman
45.description: A seductive woman falls in love with a mysterious ship's captain.

46.name: Bud Abbott Lou Costello Meet the Invisible Man
46.description: Two bumbling private eyes help a man wrongly accused of murder who has become invisible to help clear his name.

47.name: Superman and the Mole-Men
47.description: When underground beings explore the surface world from a deep oil well and inadvertantly cause a panic, only Superman can prevent a tragedy.

48.name: Fourteen Hours
48.description: An unhappy man threatens suicide by standing on the ledge of a high-rise building for 14 hours.

49.name: Hakuchi
49.description: A Japanese veteran, driven partially mad from the war, travels to the snowy island of Kameda where he soon enters a love triangle with his best friend and a disgraced woman.

50.name: Detective Story
50.description: On one day in the 21st Precinct squad room, assorted characters form a backdrop for the troubles of hard-nosed Detective Jim McLeod.
